document.discussion_title: Manila Electric 1Q Net Profit PHP4.55 Billion, Up 3% On Year
document.topic_text: By Cris Larano MANILA--Manila Electric Co. (MER.PH), the Philippines' largest power distributor by sales, said Monday its first-quarter net profit rose 3% from a year earlier to 4.55 billion pesos ($97.8 million), with electricity consumption getting a boost from warmer temperatures due to the El Nino weather phenomenon. Meralco, as the power distributor is better known, said that energy sales in the January-March quarter rose 12% to 9,077 gigaWatt-hours from 8,092 gigaWatt-hours in the same quarter of 2015. But the gain in electricity consumption was tempered by the 8.4% on-year decline in the distribution rate, which is Meralco's main income source, to 1.42 pesos a kilowatt-hour from 1.55 pesos in the year-earlier period. "The economy is growing strongly," Oscar Reyes, Meralco president, told reporters in a briefing. "Consumer spending has been helped by continued strong overseas Filipino workers' remittance inflows and business process outsourcing earnings," he added. He said the connection of new residential customers and the warmer temperatures in the first quarter--1 degree more than the comparable period last year--also helped increased consumption. Customer count increased 3.8% on-year at the end of March this year to 5.84 million, around 92% of them residential users. Capital expenditure in the first quarter dropped 66% on year to 1.19 billion pesos as Meralco awaited for regulatory approval for its capital outlay.
